intro: Anaphrenium kienerae, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its unique flowering behavior, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
